result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio Gerald Ward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).
  • Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).
  • Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, to be collected by the DOC out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES. If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 12 years of initial confinement (combination of all counts in all cases).

Concurrent with: *Modified on 8/5/2016.  Concurrent with counts three and four and with case 14CF4130 and with count two of case 14CF3085.  Credit for 318 days.

records.addlTxt: Count four, per clerical error/typo only. Now reading "concurrent" in comments.
Documents from Dr. Samuel Lubner on behalf of the defendant, received and filed.

Defendant Antonio Gerald Ward in court appearing by telephone with attorney Mary Martha Prosser.  Defendant Antonio Gerald Ward in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also appeared in court by telephone, Jean Ligocki, social worker, Robert Kovacs, corrections officer.   Case calendared for motion for modification of sentence hearing.  Arguments heard.  Sworn for defense Dr. Samuel Lubner.  The Court grants defense's motion for sentence modification.  The defendant established a new factor warranting modification of his sentences.  Defendant's public safety risk and risk of reoffending  has been dramatically reduced due to his terminal illness and limited life expectancy.  Count 1 is modified to:  10 years, consisting of 2 years initial confinement and 8 years extended supervision with sentence credit of 318 days.  Count 1 is concurrent with Counts 3 and 4, with case 14CF4130 and with count 2 of case 14CF3085.  Count 2:  The consecutive term of imprisonment of 5 years, consisting of 3 years of confinement and 2 years of extended supervision, is imposed and stayed.  The defendant will be placed on probation for 5 years, consecutive to case 14CF3085 count 2.  Count 3:  The term on imprisonment of 5 years, consisting of 3 years of confinement and 2 years of extended supervision, is modified to a sentence of 5 years consisting of 2 years of confinement and 3 years of extended supervision concurrent with counts 1, 4, with 318 days of sentence credit.  The term of imprisonment for count 4 is not modified except that the court awards 318 days of sentence credit.
Telephone call from attorney Mary Prosser to schedule motion hearing.  Motion hearing calendared for August 5, 2016 at 8:30 am in Branch 26.
DOC decision denying inmate's request for release under sec. 302.113(9g), Stats., filed in 14CF1694.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. mag
Defendant's motion to modify sentences.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Antonio Gerald Ward in court with attorney James T Moczydlowski.  Defendant Antonio Gerald Ward in custody.  Christopher J. Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PSI addressed; changes and additions made.    Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Court set restitution at zero ($0).  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  Additional statement by Eric W., Erica W.  
COUNT 1:  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 10  years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 7 years with credit for 318 DAYS
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*No contact with victim.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, to be collected by the DOC out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 12 years of initial confinement (combination of all counts in all cases).
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

COUNT 2:  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 5 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 3 years with credit for 0 DAYS
time served.

*

Defendant Antonio Gerald Ward in court with attorney James T Moczydlowski.  Defendant Antonio Gerald Ward in custody.  Christopher J. Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim notification not complete.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COUNTS 1, 2, 3, AND 4:  GUILTY.    Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  PSI ordered.

Defendant Antonio Gerald Ward in court with attorney James T Moczydlowski.  Defendant Antonio Gerald Ward in custody.  Christopher J. Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   

Jury in box.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Jury retired at the hour of 2:33 to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Trinkl and Fox who were duly sworn for that purpose.  

At the hour of 3:55 the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in verdicts of 
1. GUILTY - Robbery, Use of Force, Repeater
2. GUILTY - Battery to a Law Enforcement Officer, Repeater
3. GUILTY - Battery to a Law Enforcement Officer, Repeater
4. GUILTY - Obstructing/Resisting an Officer, Repeater
which were then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdicts and denied defense motion for judgments not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgments of conviction.

Defendant Antonio Gerald Ward in court with attorney James T Moczydlowski.  Defendant Antonio Gerald Ward in custody.  Christopher J. Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
Sidebar with ADA Megan Carmody.  Jury #10 excused (forced alternate).  

Jury in box.  Trial proceeded with 12 jurors.  Court instructed jury.   Court passed until 1:30 p.m.

Defendant Antonio Gerald Ward in court with attorney James T Moczydlowski.  Defendant Antonio Gerald Ward in custody.  Christopher J. Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jury in box. Remaining sworn for the State:  Officer Linda Scholler, MPD.  Sworn for the State:  Deputy Dennis O'Donnell, MCSD, Officer Brian Matte, MPD.  Exhibits received as reflected on official exhibit list.  State rests subject to rebuttal.   

Jury out of box.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Jury in the box.  Sworn for defense: Rayshawn W.  Defense rests.  Testimony closed.  Due to the late hour, case adjourned to 12-17-14.

Defendant Antonio Gerald Ward in court with attorney James T Moczydlowski.  Defendant Antonio Gerald Ward in custody.  Christopher J. Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Juror #5 excused.  Trial continued with 13 jurors.  Jury in box.  

Sworn for the State:  Officer David Kritzeck, MPD, Melvin Y., Officer Richard Litwin, MPD, Officer Linda Scholler, MPD.  Exhibits received as reflected on official exhibit list.  Due to the late hour, case passed until 1:15 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for December 17, 2014 at 09:00 am.
